conbody.p: The image you are trying to boot from might have an issue. In some cases the instance will not launch. In other cases, the instance will launch, go to a pending state for some time, and then shut down. This could indicate either an error in the cloud services or an error in the image itself.
Another good instance troubleshooting step is to boot from a known good image. If this second image boots, this is a strong indication that the first image has a problem.

You can also attach to the console of an instance during the boot process using the euca-get-console-output command. This allows you to view the boot messages or see if the instance reaches a login prompt. The boot messages might provide an indication as to why the image is not booting.
